Articles.Content:
Ive had this idea watching a Minecraft video. The idea is to basically build an Aircraft Carrier, using empty fuselages to float and structaral Wings to make a runway, then let it into the Ocean near KSC, and land a plane ontop of it.

Rules:

-Landing must use the gear bay

-Mods are allowed

- The Carrier and the Plane must stay intact

I havent been succseful yet, but according to a few tests, the longest possible runway should have just enough space to land on, if you fly near perfectly, and land at less than 40 m/s.

Edited August 18, 2012 by prince_of_savoy
Testing this right now, I think I will use a VTOL aircraft to land on my aircraft carrier so it doesn't have to be so long.

VTOLS have one problem. The downwards facing engines destroy anything underneath them, which destroys the carrier.

I think a glider type going at like 10 m/s (i've done it before) will land, but it might be too heavy.
I'd rather use Turboprop Engines from Damned Aerospace. Through that there should be to parts destroyed and you still get to do vertical takeoff.

Parachutes can stop a plane pretty quick, maybe a carrier style land would be the way to go. Just fly low over the carrier at about 100m/s or so, release the parachute and drop onto the deck. Sounds like a job for MechJeb.

Can't anyone but me make a glider that can fly at only 30 m/s?

Anyways, couldn't the parachutes be used for braking and not a direct fall? That's usually what I do to stop oversized aircraft.
If you want ideas for low speed gliders, look at the Javelin challenge. We have some real winners there, stuff that glides for hours at less than 30 m/s.
I attempted to make a carrier but my laptop exploded when I attempted to land on it. XD

i did it:

http://imgur.com/sFbOw

i used parachutes to stop the plane and also tryed to take off again but that didn't went well...

Interesting challenge because you've got to both optimise the runway and the plane - build a massive runway and your frame rate is likely to be so low you can't land on it.

My first attempt was a runway so big KSP took so long to load it on the runway I had to quit - it's craft file is 380KB.
Ah this is fun! But anyone else's carrier top out at 1.5 m/s in the water? *rageface*
